title: Chelsea news: Frank Lampard rates Christian Pulisic's performance in Ajax win
text:
Christian Pulisic impressed against Ajax (Picture: Getty)

Chelsea boss Frank Lampard insists he’s delighted with Christian Pulisic’s development at the club and says he had to ‘shut his ears’ at some of the criticism in recent weeks.

The American has had a mixed start at Stamford Bridge and was dropped from two matchday squads in October.

Pulisic admitted he was ‘hurt’ by being snubbed by Lampard but the forward has fought hard to get back into the team and provided an assist for Michy Batshuayi during an impressive cameo against Ajax on Wednesday.

Lampard revealed afterwards that Pulisic has suffered from the level of competition for places in his position since joining the club but praised the winger for his contribution in recent weeks.

Pulisic assisted Batshuayi’s late winner (Picture: Getty)

‘The performance tonight and his last couple of performances off the bench show something of that of course, because he’s come on and made differences,’ said Lampard.

‘In terms of handling him, I basically tried to shut my ears to too much of the outside talk. With a big player, there’s a lot said and if you listen to it all the time, you can wonder what you’re doing.

‘I understood the quality of Christian. I understood his young age. He’s just turned 21 recently and it’s a big move for him. And I have other options for him in those areas. Let’s give him full credit.

‘He wants to know what I want for him, what the PL is like, what his new team-mates are like, that’s not always going to be an easy road.

‘I’ve just stayed calm with it, I see the big picture with him. I want him to be successful at this club because he’s a good lad, he wants to do very well, that’s very clear.

‘Acting like he’s acting, training like he’s trained the last two or three weeks, playing like he’s played the last two or three weeks obviously makes me very, very happy.’

Chelsea’s win in Amsterdam takes them to the top of their Champions League group.

The Blues host the Dutch giants at Stamford Bridge in a fortnight’s time, where they can take hold of the group with another victory.
